metadata.title: CVE-2020-6573 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in video in Google Chrome on Android prior to 85.0.4183.102allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process topotentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6573` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
